data.title: Carmen Electra - Bigger Dick (feat. Mams Taylor)
data.meta_description: This is the followup to "I Like It Loud"  She performed it at White Party last week (1:25) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K_5XRcnETBo  Cover:

itunes.apple.com/us/album/bigger-dick-feat.-mams-taylor/id648582751

The clean version is called "Bigger Stick." Remixes by Jerome Farley, Joel Dickinson, and Joe Carrano are coming out in a few weeks.

There is an interview with Carmen

CARMEN ELECTRA'S GOT A BIGGER DICK THAN YOU

INTERVIEWS

By Sarah Kurchak

I know that itâ€™s only May and that you should have three examples of something before you go and declare it a trend, but Iâ€™m calling this one right now: the summer of 2013 is going to be the summer of crotch power pop.

Brooke Candy fired the opening pelvic thrust with â€œPussy Make The Rulesâ€ and its rule maker-popping video last week. Now, Carmen Electra is getting in on the action with her new single â€œBigger Dick.â€

â€œBigger Dick"â€”also known as â€œBigger D*ck,â€ â€œBigger (Expletive),â€ or â€œBigger Stick,â€ if youâ€™re feeling squeamish about the whole dick thingâ€”is just as brilliantly ridiculous as it sounds. For just under three glorious minutes, Princeâ€™s one-time protÃ©gÃ© and Hasselhoffâ€™s favorite Baywatch babe torments a former lover with a series of whip-it-out-and-measure-it taunts and naughty self-affirmations to a shamelessly addictive beat. Itâ€™s basically like the perfect marriage of Spice Girl power and the peen-rhyming prowess of Gilletteâ€™s â€œShort Dick Man.â€ And, if the wild response to the actress/singer/dancerâ€™s debut performance of the track at the Palm Springâ€™s White Party is any indication, it just might have the potential to become an almost Peaches-level potty-mouthed classic.

I talked to Ms Electra about â€œBigger Dick,â€ bigger dicks, and the big dicks that inspired the song.

Just to clarify, when you sing â€œIâ€™ve got a bigger dick than you,â€ youâ€™re not speaking literally, right?

No... It was inspired from women, including my dancers and my niece (who was kind of going through something with her husband), and it was inspired by being, I guess, in a relationship where you wear the pants. [Laughs] And I just know so many women who arenâ€™t being treated right. And that isnâ€™t my complete experience in the past, but I had one just recently, and that one was on my mind. And we just came up with the loudest way to get that across.

So having a bigger dick represents girl power and strength.

Exactly.

Isnâ€™t that a bit sexist and phallocentric, though, to measure superiority by dick size? Why canâ€™t it be â€œIâ€™ve got a bigger clit than you?â€

[Laughs] Awesome! Youâ€™re such a cutie. You have a point.

How likely do you think this song is to become a drag queen anthem?

Oh, definitely! I mean, I can see it going in that direction, for sure. And that would be awesome. I would love it.

I found the timing of this single to be pretty appropriate, seeing as how there was a study released last month in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Science that proved that size actually does matter.

Oh. Huh. Very interesting.

Do you have any personal opinions on that?

[Laughs] You know, people often ask me what the perfect date would be and I literally go blank because I think that if youâ€™re with the right person, it doesnâ€™t matter. I really feel that way. So, that being said... I also feel that way about the size. I mean, if youâ€™re with someone that makes you feel really good and happy and brings something to your life and who youâ€™re attracted to and head-over-heels for, I think thereâ€™s so many other things.

Thereâ€™s a clean version of â€œBigger Dickâ€ called â€œBigger Stick.â€ How involved were you in the process of cleaning up the song?

To be honest, I was actually really torn between coming out with such a bold way of saying it and, originally, I wanted to kind of pull back a little and just go with â€œBigger Stick.â€ [Laughs] Iâ€™m talking so seriously about something so silly! But, no. Truthfully, I felt really nervous about coming out in such a bold way. And not everyone knows whatâ€™s behind it, so I think people can interpret it in many different ways. I did have a moment of â€œIs this the right thing? Is this the right choice?â€

I thought that â€œdickâ€ was a pretty innocent word, so to see it censored as â€œBigger D*ckâ€ or â€œBigger (Expletive)â€ kind of surprised me.

I love how you think! Youâ€™re bold. These are things that I go back and forth with with myself and I know the answer, but itâ€™s... go for it! If youâ€™re going to do it, youâ€™ve got to go there. So Iâ€™m taking your word.

How do you clean up a line â€œIâ€™ll be on my shit, make you come so quickâ€ without robbing it of all meaning?

Yeah. I felt more comfortable about those lines. And obviously you have to replace a lot of curse words, but that wasnâ€™t an issue at all. It was just, you know, I think just coming from the world that Iâ€™ve been in, you get censored down a lot, and so this is a big step for me to put this out. Based on the acting and other things that Iâ€™ve done throughout my career, itâ€™s pretty bold. But after the White Party in Palm Springs, I feel good about putting it out.

I heard that the reaction to your performance of â€œBigger Dickâ€ at The White Party was absolutely insane.

You did?! Oh, I love it!

One review said that you upstaged Carly Rae Jepsen.

Oh my god.

Given that reaction, do you think that â€œBigger Dickâ€ has the potential to be the â€œCall Me Maybeâ€ of the summer of 2013?

[Laughs] That would be amazing.

I would love for â€œBigger Stickâ€ to take over the airwaves.

Oh, youâ€™re so sweet. Just to hear that alone just feels like such an accomplishment. Iâ€™ve performed a lot in my past, but it was under someone else, opening up for Prince or performing with the Pussycat Dolls. Itâ€™s a scary thing when youâ€™re restarting and when youâ€™re out there. So the White Party was the first big show that Iâ€™ve had that was just my name and it was kind of emotional for me, because there was so much love there. And so to hear that, Iâ€™m taking it all the way in.
